pkgmetadata.longdescription: Tools for Healthcare Machine Learning // Aims to make machine learning in healthcare as easy as possible. You can develop customized, reliable, high-performance machine learning models with minimal code. Models are created with automatic preprocessing, hyperparameter tuning, and algorithm selection (between 'xgboost' Chen, T. Guestrin, C. (2016) arXiv:1603.02754, 'ranger' Wright, M. N., Ziegler, A. (2017) doi:10.18637/jss.v077.i01, and 'glm' Friedman J, Hastie T, Tibshirani R. (2010) doi:10.18637/jss.v033.i01) so that they can be easily put into production. Additionally, there are tools to help understand how a model makes its predictions, select prediction threshholds for operational use, and evaluate model performance over time. Code uses 'tidyverse' syntax and most methods have an associated visualization.
